job_title: Assistant Volleyball Coach in Pella, IA
pros: Great campus, friendly people, strong athletics culture
cons: Small town, far from big cities

pros: Great people and students to work with
cons: Low pay. Less than 2% pay raise each year.

pros: Good benefits such as vacation and holidays.
cons: Have worked there over 10 years and just recently hourly pay is now $15 an hour.

I did not get a raise this year due to budget cuts. However they spend a lot of money on unnecessary student programs. They had a 5-day program in August with 8 students participating where they spent $5,000. But, I can’t even get a 25 cents an hour raise (the usual raise). Pathetic!

review_title: Excellent organization in a wonderful town
pros: Small but impactful organization. Central offers chances to develop and connect with your students and the community. Students are well-mannered and eager to work on several tasks. The college places emphasis on sports as most of the students are athletes. Pella is a wonderful small town that makes you feel like you are living in Holland.
cons: Salary is not great but decent. Too bad we don't offer Masters programs.

review_title: I don’t want to review, Glassdoor is making me
pros: It’s good it’s good it’s good
cons: There are cons sure every place has them

job_title: Research Associate in Des Moines, IA

review_title: Great Place to learn and work
pros: Easy to have a work study job
cons: Not a whole lot of hours

job_title: Prospect Management and Research Coordinator in Pella, IA
pros: Benefits, culture, supportive environment, supportive supervisors
cons: Higher ed moves slower than private industry

pros: The office I worked in had lots of younger employees and they were fun to be around. They made the work day less horrible.
cons: The management is horrible and micromanages everything. They make it seem like they care about your thoughts and input but totally disregard your opinions and concerns. The turn over rate is fairly high for how small the college is. Office moral always seems to be at a low. No appreciation for the work that is done.

review_title: Micromanagement destroying the culture and climate of the institution.
pros: Great students and tuition benefits for family.
cons: Upper management creating too many bogus leadership positions. One person has taken control of the entire college and is involved with every decision being made whether it is their area of expetise or not. Moral is bad and the climate is very negative. Poor financial decisions are being made. Not good,

pros: Central College's faculty is incredibly dedicated to providing quality education. The students are wonderful, and the campus is a beautiful place to work. We are also lucky to have a large staff of great employees willing to work themselves to the bone for abysmal compensation.
cons: Administration is incompetent to the point that I fear the institution won't exist in a few years.  It spends lavishly on administrative "necessities" (how many assistants, associates, and ridiculous layers of management do they really need?) and at the same time has cut funding for most of the college's most productive areas, which has already affected the quality of education we can provide.

review_title: Passive Aggressive Micromanagement; Overworked and Underpaid
pros: Working closely with students with a variety of interests and a passion for education.
cons: Micromanagement is a huge issue, along with miscommunication throughout the office. If you have a question or an issue, the director and VP (who are both passive aggressive) will point fingers at each other.  You're required to work more than 40 hours a week (4 hours of calling, plus weekend shifts) with already low pay (30,000-35,000) and no additional compensation.  Management is unwilling to change anything, all the way down to birthday cards.

pros: Able to grow professionally while a student, as well as the opportunity to meet many other current and prospective students.
cons: Low pay, which is to be expected when choosing a work study in college. That would be the only negative.

pros: I loved the schedule since it was mostly based on the school's academic schedule. The people I worked with were nice and the facilities were always clean.
cons: For as much as the place charges in tuition, there should be higher pay for employees
